title: Hookes law-change in length in series and parallel

content.question: In scenarios <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, shown in the figure, blocks with the masses indicated are attached to identical vertical springs. The block in each scenario is slowly lowered until it reaches equilibrium. Which of the following correctly ranks the distances <math alttext="delta x sub A, delta x sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="delta x sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> that each block is lowered?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta x sub B, is greater than, open parenthesis, delta x sub A, equals delta x sub C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="delta x sub C, is greater than delta x sub A, which is greater than delta x sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, delta x sub A, equals delta x sub B, close parenthesis, is greater than delta x sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="delta x sub C is greater than, open parenthesis, delta x sub A, equals delta x sub B, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta x sub C is greater than, open parenthesis, delta x sub A, equals delta x sub B, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
